content: Increased average fuel economy standards. Increased average fuel economy standards under Section 32902 of title 49, United States Code, now require non-passenger automobiles to meet a standard of at least 27.5 miles per gallon for model year 2022 and beyond. The Secretary shall ensure that non-passenger automobiles meet a fuel economy standard of at least 27.5 miles per gallon for model year 2022 and beyond. Average fuel economy standards for passenger automobiles will be prescribed by the Secretary at least 18 months before each model year, with separate standards for different classes based on vehicle attributes related to fuel economy. The Secretary will prescribe separate fuel economy standards for different classes of passenger automobiles based on vehicle attributes. The average fuel economy standard for passenger automobiles for model year 2022 and beyond will be at least 35 miles per gallon, with an alternative minimum standard for domestically manufactured vehicles. The average fuel economy standard for passenger automobiles will be at least 35 miles per gallon for model year 2022 and beyond, with an alternative minimum standard for domestically manufactured vehicles set at 27.5 miles per gallon or 92 percent of the projected average fuel economy for all manufacturers in that model year. The alternative minimum fuel economy standard for domestically manufactured passenger automobiles will apply if the manufacturer cannot comply with a less stringent average fuel economy standard based on vehicle attributes. The Secretary will provide a transition period for the first 3 model years when attribute-based standards are implemented. The Secretary will provide a transition period for the first 3 model years when attribute-based standards are implemented for passenger automobiles. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act. The standards for passenger automobiles under section 32902(b) of title 49, United States Code, will remain in effect until a new standard is prescribed. Chapter 329 of title 49 is amended to define a non-passenger automobile. The amendment defines a non-passenger automobile as one that is not a passenger automobile. The amendment updates section 32902 of title 49, United States Code by redefining non-passenger automobiles and making changes to subsections (h) and (j). The Secretary of Transportation will establish a corporate average fuel economy credit transferring program for manufacturers to transfer and apply credits within their fleet to non-compliant categories. The amendment updates section 32902 of title 49, United States Code by redefining non-passenger automobiles and making changes to subsections (h) and (j). It includes modifications to subsection (e) and section 32909(b). A corporate average fuel economy credit transferring program is established for manufacturers to transfer and apply credits within their fleet to non-compliant categories. Credits can be used in the same model years as earned, with a maximum increase in any compliance category of 1.0 mile per gallon. Transfers of credits are limited to comply with fuel economy provisions, and credits can only be transferred if earned in model year 2010 or later. The amendment establishes a credit transferring program for manufacturers to transfer credits within their fleet to non-compliant categories. Credits can only be transferred if earned in model year 2010 or later. The terms 'fleet' and 'compliance category of automobiles' are defined in the subsection. The amendment establishes a fuel conservation education program. The Secretary of Transportation will partner with industry groups to create a public education campaign on fuel conservation for drivers. The campaign will use various methods to reach a wide audience and the Secretary will cover up to 50% of the campaign costs, with the option to accept private funds. The Secretary of Transportation will provide up to 50% of the cost for a fuel conservation campaign and may accept private funds. Appropriations will be made as needed for this initiative.
